subject: Climate & Environment
title: Biofuels: Promise and Problems
description: A micro-lesson that makes Biofuels: Promise and Problems usable.

hook.text: Brazil powers millions of cars on ethanol made from sugarcane. It sounds like a dream.

buildup.text: Corn ethanol in the US replaces some gasoline, cutting oil imports.

discovery.text: But growing fuel crops takes farmland away from food, driving up prices for the poorest.

twist.text: Second-generation biofuels use crop waste and algae â€” no competition with food at all.

climax.text: Algae can produce 10 times more fuel per acre than corn, but scaling it is still hard.

punchline.text: The best biofuel is one that doesn't steal anyone's dinner.
